text: Clerow "Flip" Wilson Jr. (8 December 1933 â€“ 25 November 1998) was an African- American comedian whose career was successful in the 1960s and 1970s. He is perhaps best known for his television variety series The Flip Wilson Show, which earned him a Golden Globe and two Emmy Awards. He was born in Jersey City, New Jersey. On November 25, 1998, Wilson died from liver cancer in Malibu, California, aged 64. ==References== Category:1933 births Category:1998 deaths Category:Comedians from New Jersey Category:Deaths from liver cancer Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:Television personalities from New Jersey Category:Actors from Jersey City, New Jersey
title: Flip Wilson
